part.narration: Yuki — NoLifeQueen — surfaces from the sea. In the distance surfaces a woman in pajamas. satchmo_omega, reads her tag.
part.line: Yuki!
It's your girl, Nozomi!
You're sitting next to me In Real Life.
part.narration: Bullets pound the once-serene waves.
part.line: We're sitting ducks! Get out of the water!
part.narration: satchmo darts to land. NoLifeQueen follows.
part.line: We've been getting reports of a group of players modifying accounts.
They plan on modifying game databases next.
We'll have to beat them to the library—
part.narration: A group of players rush past on jet-skis.The music stops for a second.
part.line: We gotta go. Yuki, get on the ski.
part.narration: NoLifeQueen makes her decision.The Player can choose between chasing the jet-ski riders on foot or by jet-ski. Both are at similar speeds. Chasing by foot provides more opportunities for cover, while chasing by ski provides more opportunity for attack.

After a time, the two men go into a manmade tunnel and close the entrance. The jet-ski satchmo's riding slams into the closed gate and explodes. The explosion sends NoLifeQueen hundreds of feet into the air.Impressment opportunity.She lands in a crowd of players. Davis is there!
part.line: Yuki, darling!
Hey, what about me?
part.narration: satchmo and Davis laugh.
part.line: Nozomi, darling! I'll never forget the woman who drew this—
We have perps to follow.
Everybody, move out.
part.narration: Everyone mans one of the multitudes of vehicles scattered around the area. Allies follow the path of the tunnel.
part.line: We'll cut them off at the pass.
part.narration: The allies once again cross paths with the perpetrators.
part.line: There they are. Let's show them a good time, eh?
No, it is you who is going to be the very sad!
part.narration: The secondary riders on the perpetrator jet-skis break out the rocket launchers.
part.line: Fffffffff—
part.narration: The perps begin launching rockets astray. NoLifeQueen attempts to comfort everyone.
part.line: Stay calm, stay alive, stay—
part.narration: The perps launch a rocket into a rocket. The resulting explosion launches a wave one hundred feet high.The splash should completely blind the Player for a time.
Riding the remains of a wrecked machine are a lonely lovely couple. NoLifeQueen and satchmo_omega emerge from the smoke and splash, triumphant.
part.line: Saved your life!
part.narration: Half of the perps zoom by.It's only the riders, and they're setting traps. Don't tell the Player that it's only some of the perps.
part.line: Let's get those guys.
part.narration: NoLifeQueen and satchmo_omega chase after them.The Player can actually beat them this time.

For their final act, the perpetrators lay an inescapable trap — a barrier of corrupted data that, when collided with, destroys vehicles and exploits the physics system to launch people. The lovely couple hits it; Nozomi flies hundreds of feet west and NoLifeQueen far east. Yuki, watching her avatar zoom through miles of forest independent of her control, pouts.Dolly out camera from The Clan to Real Life.Yuki and Nozomi are playing on laptops in the newly established Bar.
part.line: So these guys are physics crackers.
part.narration: Conservatively-dressed Ayane, neutral mouth and still-right-hair, brings the lovely couple coffee. As she walks away, Nozomi breaks from the screen to get a view of her from behind? Nozomi goes back to the game.
part.line: Davis, Yuki's in Act 2.
Act 2?
part.narration: Yuki looks back at the game.Sudden cut to The Clan.NoLifeQueen is flying, flying, flying and she crashes through the Library window. Nozomi is next to Yuki in person but not in game. Nozomi looks at Yuki's screen.
part.line: Yuki, make sure those books don't get deleted.
Every book represents a user account.
We lose a book, we lose a player.
We'll be over there in a sec!
part.narration: NoLifeQueen infiltrates the library and beats up the perpetrators. After that, satchmo_omega, Davis, and the rest of Yuki's Clan bust through a door.
part.line: We're here!
part.narration: The reinforcements scan the room for enemies.
part.line: Oh. You're done.
She just defeated a room full of perps! Round of applause for Vice President Takeshi!
part.narration: Everyone applauds. Wow, a corporate figure associating with players? One that's good at the game, too? Cheers all around. satchmo_omega raises her arm to silence the crowd.
part.line: Wait.
Abnormal activity at 12000 game units relative.
Get ready to catch it, Yuki.
How far away is 12000 game units?
part.narration: A military utility vehicle crashes through the east window of the library.Dolly out. The Player has to have Yuki catch it.

choice.narration: The vehicle hits NoLifeQueen in the face. It cat-lands next to a bookshelf.
NoLifeQueen catches the beast-machine. She places it neatly next to her. Davis, satchmo_omega, and the bystanders applaud.

part.line: Not done yet.
part.narration: Seven more trucks crash through the windows of the library, each giving NoLifeQueen less time to intercept. The vehicles are all neatly arranged. Silence. NoLifequeen flails her arms and jumps up and down.
part.line: Rides!
part.narration: Everyone mans a vehicle. Player doesn't have to be driver, just get into a vehicle. Ramp up the music!
part.line: Let's terminate some crackers.
part.narration: Every driver turns the ignition key. The wind blows through the vast library's open windows. Some books are scattered on the ground, their pages flipping in the breeze. Some players are sitting too close to their microphones, their shallow breaths intermingling with the chirps of little video game-crickets and little video game-owls and then the vehicles explode.
part.line: What!
part.narration: The screen goes white. For a time, nothing is audible. Nothing is visible. Then comes the wind. It sounds divine. Then comes the clouds. They look beautiful.Camera should be extremely close to NoLifeQueen's face. NoLifeQueen opens her eyes. She is alone. She has full health.Zoom out extremely far to get a view of NoLifeQueen's position in the sky.From hundreds of feet in the air, NoLifeQueen falls past a cargo copter with a box carrying a cavalcade of texts, and lands next to the other players, just next to the library. Nozomi, sitting next to Yuki, relays a report.
part.line: Bad news, honey.
This zone's boundary line has been turned into a shell script:
Force delete, directories included.
The script will be executed on every file and directory it touches.
part.narration: Yuki speaks into the microphone.
part.line: That includes that box full of user accounts.
We've got to stop the helicopter!
part.narration: NoLifeQueen and her Clan take care of this by any means necessary.

choice.narration: NoLifeQueen and company destroy the heavily-guarded helicopter. This destroys the majority of the books. Many users are lost.
NoLifeQueen sneaks onto the helicopter and cuts the cord connecting the copter and the case. Some books are destroyed.
choice.line: Bring that back to the Library.

choice.narration: NoLifeQueen hijacks the helicopter and brings it back to the library. No books are destroyed.

part.narration: Yuki sulks.The music stops.
part.line: There's no way to get rid of that wall, is there?
part.narration: Davis sighs.
part.line: Nope. This is the last of Twilight Sea.
part.narration: All Allies stand their ground in silent contemplation, to get the last sight of the Twilight Sea. The wall of rogue commands deletes all data excluding avatars. Everyone looks around. Darkness.
part.line: Well...
Good night, guys.
part.narration: NoLifeQueen's Clan logs out. Nozomi logs out. Yuki logs out. Game Over.
